id-00001.effect: The draconian’s scales shatter from battle damage. The draconian has damage weakness 5 but can take two turns per round until the end of the encounter.
id-00001.name: Scaleshatter Burst 2d10+3

id-00002.effect: The arixx dribbles acid over their mandibles, causing the next strike they make to gain an edge and deal an extra 3 acid damage.
id-00002.name: Burning Maw

id-00003.effect: A draconian acting this turn flaps their wings and creates a mighty gale. Each creature adjacent to the draconian is pushed up to 4 squares, and if they have [M<2] , they are knocked prone.
id-00003.name: Guarding Gale

id-00004.name: Breath Weapon 2d10+3
id-00004.special: The damage dealt by this ability matches a damage type the draconian has immunity to.

id-00005.effect: Until the end of the round, when an angulotl moves through an inactive angulotl’s space, the inactive angulotl can use a free triggered action to jump 3 squares.
id-00005.name: Leapfrog

id-00006.effect: Each angulotl in the encounter puffs out their throat and starts loudly droning Any non-angulotl adjacent to an angulotl makes an Intuition test.
id-00006.name: Resonating Croak

id-00007.effect: An angulotl calls clouds to cover the encounter map and unleash rain until the end of the round. Any creature or object that is exposed to the sky is wet until the end of the encounter.
id-00007.name: Rainfall

id-00008.effect: The area is difficult terrain for enemies until the end of the encounter.
id-00008.name: Web

id-00009.effect: Ajax automatically treats his initial power roll as a 17. He can still roll to determine if he scores a critical hit.
id-00009.name: Insurgent

id-00010.effect: Before he uses an ability, Ajax can either shift up to 2 squares, or can cause one creature within line of effect to slide up to 2 squares, ignoring stability.
id-00010.name: Mastermind

id-00011.effect: Ajax has damage immunity 5. Additionally, any enemy who makes a power roll that includes Ajax as a target has a double bane on the roll.
id-00011.name: Vanguard

id-00012.effect: Ajax attempts to instill doubt into a creature within line of effect through logic and reason. The creature and Ajax make an opposed Reason test. If Ajax wins, he chooses to either deal 11 extra damage to one target on his next strike or to gain an additional triggered action during the current round. Ajax can’t use this feature against the same creature during the same encounter.
id-00012.name: Reason

id-00013.effect:
Until the end of the round, Ajax chooses one of the following environments he has previously visited and overlays that environment on top of the encounter map, temporarily merging multiple realities. 

Incredibly High Above the Ground: 
The winds whip and bluster. Any creature who can’t fly takes a −3 penalty to stability, and forced movement effects gain a +3 bonus to their distance against such creatures. 

Swamp: 
The ground is difficult terrain for enemies. Any creature who starts and ends their turn in the same space is restrained (save ends). 

Volcanic Canyon: 
The air is stiflingly hot. Each enemy takes 5 fire damage for each square they enter.
id-00013.name: Nexux Jewel

id-00014.effect: Ajax takes an additional main action on his turn. He can use this feature even if he is dazed.
id-00014.name: Solo Action (Ajax)

id-00015.effect: Each target makes a test using their highest characteristic.
id-00015.name: Draw Steel
id-00015.special: Ajax then raises his Blade of the Gol King above his head as four giant blades emerge from the ground to fill the area. Each target is pushed into an unoccupied space adjacent to the area after the power roll is resolved. Each blade blocks line of effect and can be dismissed by Ajax at will (no action required).
id-00015.target: Each enemy and object in the area

id-00016.effect: A basilisk acting this turn can burrow until the start of their next turn, and moves up to their speed. They have damage immunity 2 while underground. The basilisk can burrow through stone, but can’t drag other creatures underground when they do so. At the start of each of the basilisk’s turns, the Director can spend 1 Malice to let the basilisk continue burrowing.
id-00016.name: Stone Swim

id-00017.effect: The arixx takes an additional main action on their turn. They can use this feature even if he is dazed.
id-00017.name: Solo Action (Arixx)

id-00018.effect: The encounter map suddenly quakes, then begins to sink. Each creature on the ground who has [A<1] is knocked prone. Until the end of the encounter, each creature who starts their turn on the ground and can’t burrow must spend 1 additional square of movement to leave their starting position, or 2 squares if they start their turn prone or underground. A creature who starts and ends their turn in the same space on the ground and can’t burrow sinks 1 square into the ground.
id-00018.name: Earth Sink

id-00019.effect: The arixx’s underground tunnels swell with pressure, causing a sudden influx of hot gas to burst from a 3-square-by-3-square area anywhere on the surface. Each enemy in the area makes an Agility test.
id-00019.name: Geyser
id-00019.tier3: The target shifts to the nearest unoccupied space outside the area.

id-00020.effect: The ashen hoarder takes an additional main action on their turn. They can use this feature even if they are dazed.
id-00020.name: Solo Action (Ashen Hoarder)

id-00021.effect: The ashen hoarder moves up to their speed and can make a free strike against two targets.
id-00021.name: Relentless Strikes

id-00022.effect: The ashen hoarder summons a 10 wall of bones and blades into unoccupied squares within 5 squares of them. Each square of the wall has 5 Stamina. An enemy who comes adjacent to the wall for the first time in a round or starts their turn there takes 3 damage.
id-00022.name: Blade Wall

id-00023.effect: The ashen hoarder launches bone lances into the air, raining them down on enemies and impaling those unlucky enough to be on the receiving end. Each enemy within 20 squares of the ashen hoarder makes an Agility test.
id-00023.name: Bone Storm

id-00024.effect: The basilisk spits up a chunk of partly digested stone.
id-00024.name: Upchuck 2d10+2
id-00024.tier3: 4 damage; [A<2] 5 damage, prone and can’t stand (save ends)

id-00025.effect: A basilisk spews reflective spittle across an adjacent vertical surface in a 3-square-by-3-square area. The basilisk can use their Petrifying Eye Beams ability to target a square in the area, causing the area and distance of that ability to become a 20 × 3 line within 1 square of the wall.
id-00025.name: Walleye

id-00026.effect: The bredbeddle takes an additional main action on their turn. They can use this feature even if they are dazed.
id-00026.name: Solo Action (Bredbeddle)

id-00027.effect: The bredbeddle’s axe lengthens and turns a ghastly green, granting a +1 bonus to the distance of the bredbeddle’s melee strikes and the dimensions of their burst area abilities until the end of their turn.
id-00027.name: Engreen

id-00028.effect: A ghostly size 1L stockade seeps out from under the bredbeddle’s feet to fill an unoccupied square within 10 squares. When a size 1L or smaller enemy enters the stockade’s square, they are restrained (save ends). When a restrained creature is no longer restrained, the stockade fades away. At the start of each of the bredbeddle’s turns, they can slide an active stockade and any creature in it up to 5 squares.
id-00028.name: Shadow Stockade

id-00029.effect: A phantom second bredbeddle phases into view, appearing in an unoccupied space anywhere on the encounter map, then vanishing at the end of the round. The phantom bredbeddle shares the original bredbeddle’s statistics but has 24 Stamina, corruption immunity 10, and can fly. The phantom bredbeddle can take one turn and use any of the bredbeddle’s abilities except for villain actions. Only one phantom bredbeddle can be active at a time.
id-00029.name: Green Phantom

id-00030.effect: The bugbear activates a Malice Feature available to goblins.
id-00030.name: Goblin Malice Features

id-00031.effect: For every 3 Malice spent, one non-minion bugbear acting this turn grabs an iron ball and can use a maneuver to throw it at a creature within 5 squares of them. The creature takes damage equal to 8 – the number of squares the iron ball was thrown, and if they have [M<1], they are slowed (save ends).
id-00031.name: Grab Iron Ball

id-00032.effect: For every 5 Malice spent, one non-minion bugbear acting this turn grabs a javelin and can use a maneuver to throw it at a creature within 5 squares of them. The creature takes damage equal to 12 – the number of squares the javelin was thrown, and if they have [M<1], they are bleeding (save ends). While a creature is bleeding this way, any ally of the bugbear within 2 squares of them can use a free maneuver to pull the bleeding creature up to 2 squares.
id-00032.name: Grab Javelin

id-00033.effect: A bugbear infuses the encounter map with bu’gathic magic. Until the end of the encounter, all bugbears and allies have their speed doubled and can automatically climb at full speed while moving. Additionally, if the target of any bugbear or ally’s strike has [I<1], the target is also frightened (save ends) and must move their speed in a straight line away from the creature who made the strike.
id-00033.name: Show Them the Great Fear

id-00034.effect: The chimera takes an additional main action on their turn. They can use this feature even if they are dazed.
id-00034.name: Solo Action (Chimera)

id-00035.effect: The chimera takes up a defensive stance. Until the start of their next turn, the chimera can make a free strike against each enemy who comes within 2 squares of them.
id-00035.name: Defensive Snapping

id-00036.effect: The chimera shakes the ground, causing an eruption of loose rocks and debris that creates three size 2 stone objects anywhere on the encounter map. Each creature adjacent to one or more objects when they appear who has [A<2] takes 5 damage.
id-00036.name: Unstable Terrain

id-00037.effect: Until the start of the chimera’s next turn, all areas of the encounter map are shrouded in a thick cloud of ash. All creatures and objects on the map have concealment that the chimera ignores. Additionally, each enemy in the cloud who has [I<1] has line of effect only within 3 squares. The potency of this feature increases by 1 each time it’s used.
id-00037.name: Ashen Clouds

id-00038.effect: Each demon acting this turn has a double edge on abilities.
id-00038.name: Soulburn

id-00039.effect: A demon minion of your choice transforms into a non-minion horde demon of the same level.
id-00039.name: Abyssal Evolution

id-00040.effect: Two size 2 rifts to the Abyssal Wasteland appear at locations of your choice. Any demon can use an abyssal rift as a portal to another abyssal rift in the encounter, moving into any space in one rift and appearing immediately in any unoccupied space in the other rift. A non-demon who enters a rift for the first time in a round or starts their turn there takes corruption damage equal to the level of the highest-level demon on the encounter map. An abyssal rift is an immovable object that has 25 Stamina, damage immunity 2, and holy weakness 5. The rift closes when there are no demons remaining on the encounter map. Additionally, a creature who has the Magic or Psionics skill can make a Reason test or Intuition test as a maneuver while adjacent to a rift to destabilize and close it.
id-00040.name: Abyssal Rift
id-00040.tier1: The rift remains open and regains 5 Stamina.

id-00041.effect: The demon activates a Malice feature available to demons of lower level.
id-00041.name: Prior Malice Features

id-00042.effect: One demon acting this turn folds space around them, temporarily slipping in and out of the Abyssal Wasteland. Until the start of the demon’s next turn, they ignore difficult terrain, can move through solid matter, and don’t provoke opportunity attacks by moving. If the demon ends their turn inside solid matter, they are shunted out into the space from which they entered it.
id-00042.name: Abyssal Jaunt

id-00043.effect: One demon acting this turn expels blight—digested soul juice— onto the ground around them in a 3 burst that lingers until the start of their next turn. Any enemy who enters the area or starts their turn there takes 6 corruption damage, and has a double bane on power rolls until the start of their next turn.
id-00043.name: Seeping Blight

id-00044.effect: One demon acting this turn unleashes their pent-up agony and pain on every non-demon in a 5 burst. Each target makes a Presence test.\n\nThe demon removes all conditions and effects on themself that can be ended by a saving throw, and transfers all those effects to each creature soul flensed this way.
id-00044.name: Soul Flense
id-00044.tier1: 10 corruption damage; the target is soul flensed

id-00045.effect: One devil acting this turn uses a signature ability against an adjacent creature. On a tier 3 outcome, the target of the ability has a double bane on strikes (save ends).
id-00045.name: Bureaucratic Tape

id-00046.effect: One or two devils can teleport to a space adjacent to one or more creatures who aren’t hidden and make a free strike.
id-00046.name: Underhanded Tactics
id-00046.special: For each 2 additional Malice spent on this feature, one additional devil can teleport.

id-00047.effect: Each enemy in the encounter is subject to a bad deal proposed by the devils. An enemy must choose between having damage weakness 5 or taking a bane on power rolls. The bad deal lasts until the end of the encounter.
id-00047.name: Read the Small Print

id-00048.effect: Two elementals on the encounter map teleport to swap places, and each has damage immunity 2 until the end of the round.
id-00048.name: Elemental Swap

id-00049.effect: An elemental acting this turn cleaves themself into two separate elementals. Each elemental has the same statistics as the original, except that each has half the original’s current Stamina and is one size smaller. Both elementals can then shift up to their speed.
id-00049.name: Split

id-00050.effect: A cage of thorns grows around one dragonsealed enemy on the encounter map, making that enemy restrained until the end of their next turn.
id-00050.name: Cage of Thorns

id-00051.effect: The dragon takes an additional main action on their turn. They can use this feature even if they are dazed.
id-00051.name: Solo Action (Dragon)

id-00052.effect: The dragon grows a 10 wall of briars in unoccupied spaces on the encounter map. The wall blocks line of effect for all creatures except the dragon. Each square of the wall has 5 Stamina and fire weakness 5. The area can be moved through but is difficult terrain. Any creature who is force moved into or within the area takes 1 damage for each square of the area entered and is bleeding until the end of their next turn.
id-00052.name: Bramble Barricade

id-00053.effect: The dragon summons poisonous, biting thorns around their foes. Each enemy on the encounter map makes an Agility test.
id-00053.name: Afflictive Overgrowth

id-00054.effect: The dragon thickens the fog of their Gloaming Wyrmscale Aura trait and the horrors within it. Each creature in the area takes a bane on strikes made against the dragon until the start of the dragon’s next turn.
id-00054.name: Dread and Terror

id-00055.effect: The dragon manifests four 2 cubes of nightmarish apparitions anywhere on the encounter map. Each creature in the area when it appears makes an Intuition test.
id-00055.name: Doleful Visions

id-00056.effect: The dragon summons macabre, disquieting phantasms in a 10 cube within 1 square that lasts until the end of the encounter. Any enemy who enters the area for the first time in a round or starts their turn there takes 6 psychic damage, or 8 psychic damage if they are dragonsealed by the gloom dragon. Additionally, the enemy’s Intuition score is treated as 1 lower for the purpose of resisting potencies until the end of the encounter.
id-00056.name: Phantasmagoria!

id-00057.effect: While the dragon is flying, they shape themself into a blade and fall. Each creature and object in the dragon’s space when they hit the ground and in a 6 × 4 line within 1 square of the dragon takes 7 damage. A creature who takes this damage and has [A<4] takes 4 extra damage per square the dragon fell and is restrained (save ends). A creature not restrained this way can move into the nearest unoccupied space.
id-00057.name: Swordfall

id-00058.effect: The dragon shakes loose a cloud of shattered weapons in a 6 × 4 line within 1 square of them. Each creature and object in the area makes an Agility test.
id-00058.name: Shower of Blades

id-00059.effect: The dragon superheats the ground across the encounter map until the end of the round. Any enemy who starts their turn on the ground is slagged as if affected by the dragon’s Slag Spew ability.
id-00059.name: Meltdown

id-00060.effect: The dragon expands their wings to create a shroud of shadow. Until the start of the dragon’s next turn, any strike made against them takes a bane.
id-00060.name: Black Skies

id-00061.effect: The dragon flies up to 10 squares and carries fated souls with them. Each creature in the area of the dragon’s Stagnant Wyrmscale Aura trait makes a Presence test.
id-00061.name: Rise and Fall

id-00062.effect: Each edge of the encounter map burns with intangible purple flames until the end of the encounter. The flames expand by 1 square at the end of every turn. Any enemy takes 5 corruption damage for each square of flames they enter.
id-00062.name: Burn It Right Down

id-00063.effect: The next time the dragon uses their Crescent Claws ability, they can also slide the target up to 5 squares. If the target is dragonsealed, the dragon can vertical slide them instead.
id-00063.name: Liftoff

id-00064.effect: The dragon drops stars into five 2 cubes anywhere on the encounter map. The area is difficult terrain, and each creature and object in the area when it appears makes an Agility test.
id-00064.name: Starfall

id-00065.effect: A black hole manifests as a 1 cube within 20 squares of the dragon in an unoccupied space. Each creature who has [M<5] and each object of size 3 or smaller is vertical pulled 2 squares toward the area at the start of each round, ignoring stability. Any creature who starts their turn in the area or any object in the area at the end of the round suffers the effect of the dragon’s Voidlight Breath ability, and the black hole disappears.
id-00065.name: Event Horizon

id-00066.effect: A dwarf can destroy one adjacent object or square of wall for each 3 Malice spent. Each enemy adjacent to the destroyed object or square takes the object’s Stamina in damage (3 for wood, 6 for stone, or 9 for metal).
id-00066.name: Breaching Charge

id-00067.effect: Each dwarf acting this turn can automatically climb at full speed while moving. At any point during this movement, they can make a free strike.
id-00067.name: Rappelling Barrage

id-00068.effect: Each target makes an Agility test.
id-00068.name: Snaring Line
id-00068.special: The snaring line remains until the end of the encounter. Any enemy who moves into the area for the first time in a round or starts their turn there must make the test. \n\nSpecial: This ability can’t be used by a minion.

id-00069.effect: Until the end of the encounter, the target has a +5 bonus to speed and a +5 damage bonus to strikes. Additionally, whenever an elemental within the target’s line of effect uses an ability with “Convocation” in the name, the target also gains the effects of that ability.
id-00069.name: Convocation of Chaos

id-00070.effect: Until the end of the round, whenever a high elf uses a magic ability, they can use it as if they were occupying the square of another high elf on the encounter map to whom they have line of effect.
id-00070.name: Chaincast

id-00071.effect: The high elf chooses a damage type and condition from one of the following combinations: cold damage and slowed, poison damage and weakened, or corruption damage and frightened.
id-00071.name: Gift From an Accursed Tome 2d10+2
id-00071.special: This ability can’t be used by a minion.

id-00072.effect: Until the end of the round, each high elf in the encounter gains a +4 bonus to speed, and whenever a high elf uses an ability against an enemy, each high elf adjacent to that enemy can make a free strike against them.
id-00072.name: In Defiance of Time

id-00073.effect: Each shadow elf acting this turn can attempt to hide as a free maneuver if they have concealment.
id-00073.name: Watch Me Disappear

id-00074.effect: When any shadow elf acting this turn makes a strike against a target who has [I<2] in addition to the strike’s regular effects, the target is bleeding (save ends) or slowed (save ends).
id-00074.name: Extra Dimension

id-00075.effect: The shadow elves synthesize a concentrated pocket manifold reminiscent of Equinox and graft it onto the encounter map. Until the end of the encounter, all creatures can see shadow elves in full color, and shadow elves no longer benefit from their Of the Umbra trait. Additionally, the potency of all shadow elf abilities increases by 2, and any enemy making a saving throw against an effect imposed by a shadow elf ability must roll an 8 or higher as they feel the effect across two worlds.
id-00075.name: Home Is Where the Hurt Is

id-00076.effect: Each wode elf who ends this turn hidden can shift up to their speed while remaining hidden.
id-00076.name: Forest Network

id-00077.effect: Until the end of the round, each wode elf gains an edge on abilities, and their strikes can slide a target up to 2 squares in addition to their usual effects. If a strike already imposes forced movement, this slide happens after that forced movement. A creature force moved by a wode elf’s strike who ends this forced movement in difficult terrain is restrained until the end of their next turn.
id-00077.name: Punishing Regrowth

id-00078.effect: Vines rapidly grow across the entire encounter map. Each enemy in the encounter makes an Agility test.
id-00078.name: Vines Everywhere

id-00079.effect: The fossil cryptic slides one creature on the ground up to 5 squares. If the creature is prone, this forced movement ignores stability.
id-00079.name: Floor Mosaic

id-00080.effect: Two pillars of stone 1 square wide either thrust up out of the ground or jut down from the ceiling anywhere on the encounter map, to a height of up to 5 squares. A creature in the area of a pillar before it appears is knocked prone on its surface. If the creature comes into contact with the ceiling above or the floor beneath the pillar and has [M<2] they are restrained (save ends).
id-00080.name: Stone Pillars

id-00081.effect: The fossil cryptic takes an additional main action on their turn. They can use this feature even if they are dazed.
id-00081.name: Solo Action (Fossil Cryptic)

id-00082.effect: The air across the encounter map is thick with dust until the end of the encounter. Each enemy in the dust is suffocating. Additionally, at the end of each round, each enemy in the dust makes a Might test.
id-00082.name: Choking Dust
id-00082.tier1: Until the end of the enemy’s next turn, their stability is reduced to 0, and any forced movement effects targeting them gain a +2 bonus to the distance moved.

id-00083.effect: A giant unearths a structure, hazard, or chunk of the encounter map and launches it to fill the area. Each target makes an Agility test.
id-00083.name: Hurl Landscape
id-00083.tier1: 18 damage; prone and can’t stand (save ends)

id-00084.effect: Each giant in the encounter takes a deep breath and yells, pushing each creature within 3 squares of them up to 10 squares. A creature who can be pushed by more than one giant is pushed by one giant of your choice.
id-00084.name: Bellow

id-00085.effect: A giant creates a fissure along the ground, either in a 15 × 2 line within 1 or a 10 × 3 line within 2, and that opens up to a depth of 6 squares. Each giant in the area can shift into the nearest unoccupied space outside the fissure. Each non-giant in the area makes an Agility test.
id-00085.name: Titanic Tear
id-00085.tier1: 10 damage; the target falls into the fissure, and is prone and can’t stand (EoT)
id-00085.tier2: 10 damage; the target is prone and hanging onto the edge of the fissure
id-00085.tier3: The target can shift into the nearest unoccupied space outside the fissure.

id-00086.effect: A gnoll acting this turn drops an iron-jawed snare into the area. The first time any enemy moves into the area, they make an Agility test. If they were unaware of the snare, the test takes a bane.
id-00086.name: Iron Jaws
id-00086.special: While an enemy is bleeding this way, each gnoll in the encounter gains an edge on strikes made against them.

id-00087.effect: One gnoll minion suddenly explodes into a pool of blood, splattering the area within 3 squares of them. Any gnoll who starts their turn in this area deals an extra 5 damage on their next strike before the end of their turn. Once per round, an abyssal hyena who starts their turn in the area turns into a gnoll marauder, keeping their current Stamina.
id-00087.name: Bloodpool

id-00088.effect: Until the end of the encounter, the encounter map is encased in a soundscape of laughter and howling. Each enemy takes a bane on the first power roll they make each round. Whenever a gnoll is killed, this effect is suppressed until the start of the next round.
id-00088.name: Echoes of Laughter

id-00089.effect: Each goblin in the encounter gains a +2 bonus to speed until the end of the round.
id-00089.name: Goblin Mode

id-00090.effect: Each enemy in the encounter takes 1 damage for each goblin adjacent to them.
id-00090.name: Tiny Stabs

id-00091.effect: The encounter map is covered in a green mist that lasts until the end of the round, and which can’t be dispersed by wind. All areas of the map are difficult terrain for non-goblins, and each non-goblin on the map makes a Might test.
id-00091.name: Swamp Stink
id-00091.tier1: 5 poison damage; the creature is weakened until the mist disappears.
id-00091.tier2: The creature is weakened until the mist disappears.

id-00092.effect: The griffon flies up to their speed, and can make a free strike against each creature who makes an opportunity attack against them during this movement.
id-00092.name: Swoop

id-00093.effect: A griffon acting this turn unleashes a hideous screech at one enemy within 5 squares of them, forcing that creature to make an Intuition test.
id-00093.name: Piercing Cry

id-00094.effect: Winds bluster and blow across the encounter map. Until the end of the encounter, each creature who can’t fly or isn’t mounted on a flying creature takes a −3 penalty to stability, and any forced movement effect targeting such a creature moves them an additional 5 squares.
id-00094.name: Wildwinds

id-00095.effect: The hag takes an additional main action on their turn. They can use this feature even if they are dazed.
id-00095.name: Solo Action (Hag)

id-00096.effect: The hag utters terrible words that push each enemy within 2 squares of them up to 3 squares.
id-00096.name: Casting Curses and Bodies

id-00097.effect: After making the power roll, the hag can choose to replace the damage type and condition with lightning damage and dazed, or cold damage and slowed.
id-00097.name: Hag Wyrd 2d10 + 3

id-00098.effect: The hag’s hut springs to life. It enters the encounter map within 10 squares of the hag if it isn’t already there and takes its turn. The hut is size 4, has 75 Stamina and damage immunity 3, and has speed 8 from its powerful set of animal legs. This feature can’t be used if the hut is reduced to 0 Stamina. In addition to its move action, the house can take only the following main action. -Kick
id-00098.name: House Call

notes.p: Kick 2d10 + 3 (Signature Ability)

id-00099.effect: Each hobgoblin in the encounter shifts up to their speed and can take the Defend main action.
id-00099.name: Operation Tactical Swarm

id-00100.effect: Each goblin in the encounter gains a +3 bonus to speed until the end of the round.
id-00100.name: Operation Goblin Mode

id-00101.effect: The hobgoblin activates a Malice Feature available to goblins.
id-00101.name: Goblin Malice Features

id-00102.effect: Until the end of the round, the ground throughout the encounter map becomes blazing hot. Any enemy takes 1 fire damage for each square of the ground they enter. Any enemy who ends their turn on the ground has fire weakness 2 until the start of their next turn.
id-00102.name: Operation Earth Sear

id-00103.effect: Each non-minion human in the encounter regains Stamina equal to 5 times their level.
id-00103.name: Staying Power

id-00104.effect: Each human acting this turn gains an edge on abilities until the end of their turn, or has a double edge on any ability that targets an enemy affected by a condition.
id-00104.name: Exploit Opening

id-00105.name: Alchemical Device 2d10+2
id-00105.special: This ability can’t be used by a minion.
id-00105.target: Each enemy and object in the area

id-00106.effect: The kingfissure worm takes an additional main action on their turn. They can use this feature even if they are dazed.
id-00106.name: Solo Action (Worm)

id-00107.effect: Each creature within 5 squares of the kingfissure worm takes 5 damage, and if they have [A<4] they are knocked prone. The kingfissure worm can use this ability only once per round.
id-00107.name: Aftershock
id-00107.trigger: A creature deals damage to the kingfissure worm or one of their tongues.

id-00108.effect: The kingfissure worm loses 35 Stamina and regrows one tongue, to a maximum of three tongues. The worm is then dazed until the end of their turn.
id-00108.name: Spontaneous Regeneration

id-00109.effect: Until the end of the next round, each target takes a −3 penalty to stability, treats all terrain as difficult terrain, and takes 10 damage whenever they are knocked prone.
id-00109.name: Megaquake 2d10+5
id-00109.target: Each enemy and object in the area

id-00110.effect: Until the end of the round, all kobolds with Shield? Shield! Impose an additional bane on incoming strikes and abilities.
id-00110.name: Shield Wall

id-00111.effect: Two kobolds take their turns in a row.
id-00111.name: Set the Initiative

id-00112.effect: Up to 3 kobolds make a free strike, swaps positions with an adjacent kobold, and then that kobold makes a free strike.
id-00112.name: Maniple Tactics

id-00113.effect: Each lightbender in the encounter shines radiantly, distorting the senses of any enemy within 5 squares of them. Each affected enemy makes a Reason test.
id-00113.name: Everything the Light Touches
id-00113.tier1: The target doesn’t have line of effect to any lightbender (save ends).
id-00113.tier2: The target doesn’t have line of effect to any lightbender (EoT).

id-00114.effect: Each lightbender acting this turn can create a duplicate lightbender in an unoccupied space adjacent to them. The duplicate is indistinguishable from the lightbender except by supernatural means, has 1 Stamina, and has the lightbender’s speed. A duplicate acts on the lightbender’s turn but can take only move actions. Once per round before or after using an ability, a lightbender can trade places with any lightbender duplicate.
id-00114.name: Duplicate

id-00115.effect: Each lightbender acting this turn can teleport up to their speed as a move action and attempt to hide as a free maneuver, all until the start of their next turn.
id-00115.name: Silent Prow

id-00116.effect: Waist-high water floods the entire encounter map. Any lizardfolk submerged in water gains an edge on abilities and doubles their speed while swimming. If there are no open water pits on the encounter map, the water drains away at the end of the round.
id-00116.name: Flood the Shores

id-00117.effect: A lizardfolk acting this turn unearths a magical size 2 pit that is 2 squares deep and filled with water. Any lizardfolk who moves into, then exits the pit on their turn gains 10 temporary Stamina, regrows their tail if applicable, and ends one effect on them that can be ended by a saving throw. While adjacent to the pit, any creature who can burrow or who has the Nature skill can make a Might test or a Reason test to drain it.
id-00117.name: Water Pit
id-00117.tier1: The creature falls into the pit and is knocked prone.
id-00117.tier2: The creature fails to empty the pit.

id-00118.effect: A lizardfolk acting this turn sets up a net trap into the area. The first time an enemy steps into a square with a net trap, they make an Agility test. If the creature was unaware of the trap, they take a bane on the test.
id-00118.name: Net Trap
id-00118.special: Any creature not also restrained by a net trap who is adjacent to a creature restrained by the trap can free them as a maneuver.

id-00119.effect: The manticore sprays tail spikes across the ground within 5 squares of them. Each enemy in that area who has [A<3] is bleeding (save ends). Additionally, the area is difficult terrain, and any enemy takes 3 poison damage for each square of the area they enter. An enemy who takes 9 poison damage this way on one turn is weakened until the end of the encounter.
id-00119.name: Barrage of Barbs

id-00120.effect: The manticore lets out an unnerving cry. Each enemy within the manticore’s line of effect makes an Intuition test.
id-00120.name: Desperate Howl

id-00121.effect: The manticore takes an additional main action on their turn. They can use this feature even if they are dazed.
id-00121.name: Solo Action (Manticore)

id-00122.effect: The manticore uses their mimicry in an attempt to unnerve one creature within their line of effect. If the target has [R<4], they take a bane on power rolls against the manticore (save ends). Each time this feature is used against the same target during the encounter, its potency decreases by 2.
id-00122.name: Uncanny Mimicry

id-00124.effect: The medusa takes an additional main action on their turn. They can use this feature even if they are dazed.
id-00124.name: Solo Action (Medusa)

id-00125.effect: At a time of the medusa’s choosing, a charmed creature moves up to their speed and makes a free strike against an enemy of the medusa’s choice as a free triggered action. The creature is then no longer charmed.
id-00125.name: Ssstop and Lisssten 2d10+4

id-00126.effect: The medusa causes three stone statues within 10 squares of them to each shatter in a 2-cube explosion. Each enemy in one of those areas makes a Might test. An enemy restrained or slowed by the medusa’s Petrify ability has a double bane on the test.
id-00126.name: Shatter Victims

id-00127.effect: For each 3 Malice spent, one minotaur acting this turn gains a +4 bonus to speed and ignores difficult terrain until the start of their next turn.
id-00127.name: Bull Rush

id-00128.effect: One minotaur acting this turn halves any damage they take, and can use the Knockback maneuver as a free triggered action whenever an enemy comes adjacent to them, all until the start of their next turn.
id-00128.name: Cut the … Nonsense!

id-00129.effect: All minotaurs in the encounter fill the area around them with psychic impressions of feeling lost and isolated. Each enemy within 5 squares of a minotaur is teleported up to 5 squares and makes an Intuition test.
id-00129.name: Bullseye
id-00129.tier1: The target has line of effect only within 3 squares and is frightened of all minotaurs (save ends).
id-00129.tier2: The target has line of effect only within 3 squares (EoT).

id-00130.effect: One ogre acting this turn jumps and lands on their rear, causing a 3 burst shockwave. Each size 1 creature in the area makes a Might test or Agility test.
id-00130.name: Shockwave

id-00131.effect: Each ogre in the encounter shifts up to their speed and can make a free strike. If they can, they gang up on the same target rather than picking different targets.
id-00131.name: Bully

id-00132.effect: Until the end of the round, each ogre has damage immunity 5 and deals an extra 5 damage with abilities, and heroic abilities that target any ogre have their Heroic Resource cost reduced by 1 (to a minimum of 1).
id-00132.name: Rampage

id-00133.effect: The olothec takes an additional main action on their turn. They can use this feature even if they are dazed.
id-00133.name: Solo Action (Olothec)

id-00134.effect: The olothec can pull a target grabbed this way adjacent to them. While grabbed this way, a target can’t make saving throws to end any other effects, and the olothec has a double edge on strikes against them.
id-00134.name: Writhing Envelopment 2d10+4
id-00134.target: One slimed, transformed, or devolved creature

id-00135.effect: The olothec broadcasts their memory of the universe in its primordial state—a sweeping cacophony of transcendental irrationality and unceasing change. Until the end of the encounter, any creature who starts their turn within 3 squares of the olothec and has [R<3] is dazed and slowed until the end of their next turn).
id-00135.name: Memory of Chaos

id-00136.effect: Each orc shifts up to their speed, moving through enemy spaces if they can. Each enemy passed through during this movement makes a Might test.
id-00136.name: Overwhelming March

id-00137.effect: An orc acting this turn summons 2 mohlers out of the ground, who dig a trench that is a 10 × 1 line within 10 squares when they appear. The trench is 2 squares deep and is difficult terrain. The trench can’t be created directly underneath creatures.
id-00137.name: Mohler Trench

id-00138.effect: The ground shakes as a group of mohlers dig a 5 cube pit beneath an area where at least one creature is on the ground. The area is difficult terrain. Each orc in the area can shift into the nearest unoccupied space outside the pit before it is completed. Each nonorc in the area makes an Agility test.
id-00138.name: Mohler Cavity
id-00138.tier1: 4 damage; the target falls; prone and can’t stand (EoT)
id-00138.tier3: The target can shift into the nearest unoccupied space outside the pit.

id-00001.effect_3: Lydixavus flies up to their speed, leaving a size 1S ice mine in the space they took off from. The ice mine explodes when an enemy enters its space, using the power roll for the Ice Lob ability, and targeting the triggering creature and each creature and object adjacent to the ice mine.
id-00001.effect_4: Lydixavus uses their signature ability again, targeting a creature within 5 squares of the original target.
id-00001.name: Lydixavus the Deadeye

notes.p: Draconians—wyrmwights as some call them, also known as dragon knights in Orden—are a people created through an obscure ritual known as Dracogenesis. Most draconians have an elemental affinity connected to their draconic scales, which they can change given enough time and training. Six individual draconians are presented in this section—not an adventuring party, but six warriors whose reputations precede them. All are likely to be found serving in various military forces as high-ranking commanders.

Nothing escapes Lydixavus (lee-DIX-uh-vas) or their unrivaled precision. After decades of careful training, they have honed their breath weapon into a swift and far-traveling bullet of ice. Lydixavus is motivated by revenge. Each scar, each dent in their scales tells a story, and Lydixavus aims to return those gifts tenfold to those who bestowed them.

Most draconians speak Caelian in addition to the languages of their employers and creators. Lydixavus, Phrrygalax, and Dorzinuuth all speak Caelian and Vastariax. Aeolyxria speaks Caelian and the First Language. Locratix speaks Caelian and Oaxuatl. Myxovidan speaks Caelian and Axiomatic.
At the start of any draconian's turn, you can spend Malice to activate one of the following features:

id-00001.target_2: Each enemy and object in the area
id-00001.tier2: 16 cold damage; the target takes a bane on their next strike
id-00001.tier3: 19 cold damage; the target has a double bane on their next\nstrike
id-00001.traits_name: Lydixavus knows the location of every creature who has ever dealt damage to them. If any of those creatures are within 20 squares of Lydixavus, Lydixavus always has line of effect to them as long as a size 1 opening exists between Lydixavus and the target.
id-00001.traits_name1: Lydixavus knows the location of every creature who has ever dealt damage to them. If any of those creatures are within 20 squares of Lydixavus, Lydixavus always has line of effect to them as long as a size 1 opening exists between Lydixavus and the target.
id-00001.trigger_4: Lydixavus obtains a tier 1 outcome on their signature ability.

id-00002.effect: The cleaver jumps up to 4 squares before or after making this strike.
id-00002.name: Angulotl Cleaver

notes.p: Found in freshwater swamps, rivers, and rainforests, angulotls (angwa- LAH-tuls) are diminutive, brightly colored amphibious humanoids. Rather than defending their settlements and breeding grounds against hostile creatures, these poisonous frog folk prefer to establish their homes in places that are nigh-impossible for other humanoids to find, such as underwater caves and other enclosed spaces accessible only by water. Angulotls are happy to hide and watch a gaggle of noisy adventurers stumble past the entrance to their clutch without realizing it. But though they prefer to avoid combat, whenever they’re threatened or pressed, angulotls can turn deadly.

Angulotls are poisonous creatures, which suits their preference to avoid aggression—because they don’t need it! The contact toxin secreted by their skin gives them an edge in close combat, and they also distill this toxin into more potent forms for coating blades and tipping darts.

Angulotl physiology is delicately balanced, and it doesn’t take much to upset that balance. While toxins don’t kill them, they are still affected by pollutants in their waters. Ongoing contamination of their environment can corrupt angulotls, making them aggressive, confused, and angry. Most pollution-corrupted angulotls eventually attack any creature who crosses their path—even other angulotls! Runoff from magical experimentation seems to affect them the most—and sometimes grants them strange abilities.

Angulotls breathe through their skin, so they need to stay damp or they suffocate. They often avoid travel in dry areas, and they prefer not to stray far from sources of freshwater unless it’s raining.

Known as q’ukutxal (koo-OOK-oot-shaal) to angulotls, the clawfish resembles a moray eel with eight reptilian legs. These small animals can slither through grass and clamber up trees nearly as well as they glide through river currents. Angulotls train them not only to pull rafts, but to cleverly fight by grabbing and electrocuting foes.
Most angulotls speak Filliaric.

Angulotls make use of a unique effect called “wet.” While wet, an angulotl doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks by moving. At the same time, any non-angulotl who is wet and ends their turn with none of their movement remaining slips and falls prone. Several angulotl abilities can impose this effect, but a creature in an encounter featuring angulotls can also become wet by entering water, as the Director determines.
At the start of any angulotl’s turn, you can spend Malice to activate one of the following features:

id-00002.target: One creature or object per minion
id-00002.traits_name1: Whenever an adjacent enemy grabs the cleaver or uses a melee ability against them, that enemy takes 1 poison damage.

id-00003.name: Angulotl Pollywog

id-00003.tier2: 1 poison damage; the pollywog can shift 1 square
id-00003.tier3: 1 poison damage; the pollywog can shift 3 squares
id-00003.traits_name1: Any angulotl who can target the pollywog with a melee free strike can eat them as a maneuver. The angulotl regains 4 Stamina and is wet until the end of their next turn.

id-00004.effect: The dart gains an edge on this ability against any target who has less than full Stamina.
id-00004.name: Angulotl Dart

id-00005.effect: Any target grabbed this way takes 2 lightning damage at the start of each of their turns.

id-00005.target: One creature or object per minion
id-00005.traits_name1: At the start of each of their turns, the clawfish deals 2 lightning damage to each wet enemy within 2 squares.

id-00006.name: Angulotl Needler

id-00006.special: 2 Malice: A target who has [M < 2] is weakened (save ends). A target weakened this way takes 2 poison damage at the start of each of their turns.
id-00006.traits_name1: Whenever an adjacent enemy grabs the needler or uses a melee ability against them, that enemy takes 2 poison damage.

id-00007.effect: The target is wet (save ends). Any ally targeted by this ability ignores the damage, is wet until the end of the encounter, and is pulled up to 6 squares, ignoring stability.
id-00007.effect_2: The slink jumps up to 3 squares. If they have cover or concealment when they land, they can attempt to hide.
id-00007.name: Angulotl Slink

At the start of any angulotl’s turn, you can spend Malice to activate one of the following features:

id-00007.traits_name1: The slink excretes a sticky residue into their square at the end of each of their turns. Any non-angulotl who enters or leaves the square is stuck, and must use a maneuver to break free or be restrained until the end of their turn. Objects are likewise affected, and a creature must use a maneuver to remove an object from the square.
id-00007.traits_name2: Whenever an adjacent enemy grabs the slink or uses a melee ability against them, that enemy takes 2 poison damage.

id-00008.effect: An illuminated creature or object can’t hide or become invisible, and any strike made against an illuminated target gains an edge.
id-00008.effect_2: A bubble of toxic gas fills the area, ready to pop. If any creature or object touches the bubble or if the bubble takes damage, it bursts. Each angulotl adjacent to the bubble is wet until the end of the encounter, and each enemy adjacent to the bubble makes a Might test.
id-00008.name: Angulotl Wave

Angulotls make use of a unique effect called “wet.” While wet, an angulotl doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks by moving. At the same time, any non-angulotl who is wet and ends their turn with none of their movement remaining slips and falls prone. Several angulotl abilities can impose this effect, but a creature in an encounter featuring angulotls can also become wet by entering water, as the Director determines.
At the start of any angulotl’s turn, you can spend Malice to activate one of the following features:

id-00008.tier1_2: 3 poison damage; the target is wet and weakened (save ends)
id-00008.tier2: 4 holy damage; [R<1] the target is illuminated (save ends)
id-00008.tier2_2: 2 poison damage; the target is wet (save ends)
id-00008.tier3: 5 holy damage; [R<2] the target is illuminated (save ends)
id-00008.tier3_2: 1 poison damage; the target is wet (EoT)
id-00008.traits_name1: Whenever an adjacent enemy grabs the wave or uses a melee ability against them, that enemy takes 2 poison damage.

id-00009.effect: The next time the target makes a strike against the daybringer, the target takes 4 acid damage after the strike is resolved.
id-00009.effect_2: The daybringer expands their throat to make it resemble the sun until the start of their next turn. During that time, each angulotl who starts their turn within 10 squares of the daybringer regains 5 Stamina and gains a +3 bonus to speed until the end of their turn.
id-00009.effect_3: The outcome of the strike’s power roll is reduced by one tier.
id-00009.effect_4: Four angulotl pollywogs erupt from the daybringer’s back and waddle into unoccupied spaces within distance.
id-00009.effect_5: Each target can jump up to 4 squares. Each non-minion target can make a free strike at the end of the jump.
id-00009.effect_6: The encounter map dries up and each enemy and object on it is illuminated until the end of the encounter. An illuminated creature or object can’t hide or become invisible, and any strike made against an illuminated target gains an edge. Additionally, each enemy in the encounter who is wet has that effect end and takes 6 acid damage. Each angulotl in the encounter has a double edge on their next strike.
id-00009.name: Angulotl Daybringer

notes.p: Found in freshwater swamps, rivers, and rainforests, angulotls (angwa- LAH-tuls) are diminutive, brightly colored amphibious humanoids. Rather than defending their settlements and breeding grounds against hostile creatures, these poisonous frog folk prefer to establish their homes in places that are nigh-impossible for other humanoids to find, such as underwater caves and other enclosed spaces accessible only by water. Angulotls are happy to hide and watch a gaggle of noisy adventurers stumble past the entrance to their clutch without realizing it. But though they prefer to avoid combat, whenever they’re threatened or pressed, angulotls can turn deadly.

Angulotls are poisonous creatures, which suits their preference to avoid aggression—because they don’t need it! The contact toxin secreted by their skin gives them an edge in close combat, and they also distill this toxin into more potent forms for coating blades and tipping darts.

Angulotl physiology is delicately balanced, and it doesn’t take much to upset that balance. While toxins don’t kill them, they are still affected by pollutants in their waters. Ongoing contamination of their environment can corrupt angulotls, making them aggressive, confused, and angry. Most pollution-corrupted angulotls eventually attack any creature who crosses their path—even other angulotls! Runoff from magical experimentation seems to affect them the most—and sometimes grants them strange abilities.

Angulotls breathe through their skin, so they need to stay damp or they suffocate. They often avoid travel in dry areas, and they prefer not to stray far from sources of freshwater unless it’s raining.

Known as q’ukutxal (koo-OOK-oot-shaal) to angulotls, the clawfish resembles a moray eel with eight reptilian legs. These small animals can slither through grass and clamber up trees nearly as well as they glide through river currents. Angulotls train them not only to pull rafts, but to cleverly fight by grabbing and electrocuting foes.
Most angulotls speak Filliaric.

Angulotls make use of a unique effect called “wet.” While wet, an angulotl doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks by moving. At the same time, any non-angulotl who is wet and ends their turn with none of their movement remaining slips and falls prone. Several angulotl abilities can impose this effect, but a creature in an encounter featuring angulotls can also become wet by entering water, as the Director determines.
At the start of any angulotl’s turn, you can spend Malice to activate one of the following features:

id-00009.special: 1 Malice: The daybringer jumps up to 3 squares before or after using this ability.
id-00009.special_3: 2 Malice: The target is pulled up to 4 squares after the strike resolves.
id-00009.target_5: Self and each ally in the area
id-00009.traits_name1: At the end of each of the daybringer’s turns, they can either take 5 damage or end the wet effect on an adjacent creature in order to end one effect on them that can be ended by a saving throw. This damage can’t be reduced in any way.
id-00009.traits_name2: Whenever an adjacent enemy grabs the daybringer or uses a melee ability against them, that enemy takes 3 poison damage.
id-00009.trigger_3: The target makes a strike against the daybringer or an ally that isn’t a critical hit.

id-00010.effect: The animal shifts up to 2 squares between strikes.
id-00010.effect_2: The animal moves up to their speed.
id-00010.name: Animal

notes.p: The natural denizens of every world, animals ferocious, atrocious, and precocious roam the lands between and among settlements of humanoids and other folk. Whether they graze or hunt, stay solitary or move in packs, fight danger or fly from it, all animals share a singular goal—to live. Most animals are not monsters, but some are twisted by magic and malice to become monsters. A hero wouldn’t mercilessly kill a pack of hungry wolves—but they’ll slay rot-magic dire wolves created by vampires. In many cases, animals are more likely to be bystanders than threats in an encounter.

This section presents a number of default animal stat blocks with basic features. You can customize those stat blocks by adding traits from the following categories to more closely model the animal’s most identifiable features. You can spend up to 4 points on traits to add to a stat block without increasing the encounter value. Each point you spend after 4 increases the stat block’s EV by 2. Unless otherwise specified, you can select a trait only once.
Mobility traits cover a wide range of the options that keep animals moving.
The animal can burrow.
+1 Point: The animal can burrow through stone, creating a tunnel of their size in each square of stone they move through.
Typically Used By: Ants, groundhogs, mohlers.
The animal can automatically climb at full speed while moving.
Typically Used By: Jaguars, monkeys.
The animal can fly, and their stability decreases by 2 (to a minimum of 0). +1 Point: The animal can also hover.
Typically Used By: Bees, birds.
On their turn, the animal can high jump or long jump up to half their speed. This jump can allow the animal to move more squares than their speed.
Typically Used By: Frogs, rabbits.
The animal can use a move action to shift up to 3 squares, even while prone.
Typically Used By: Snakes, vermin.
The animal has a +2 bonus to speed, and they ignore difficult terrain. (This trait can be selected twice.)
Typically Used By: Tigers, wolves.
The animal can automatically swim at full speed while moving.
Typically Used By: Fish, penguins.
Defensive traits help animals stay out of danger—or to set ambushes for unwary prey.
The animal can attempt to hide even while observed. While no enemy has line of effect to the animal, they can automatically hide at the end of their turn.
Typically Used By: Chameleons, foxes, tigers.
As a maneuver, the animal makes an imposing display. Each enemy within 2 squares of the animal who has [I<1] must shift 3 squares in a straight line away from the animal.
Typically Used By: Aardvarks, lions, peacocks.
While adjacent to an ally, the animal can’t be flanked or be made frightened.
Typically Used By: Hyenas, sheep, wolves.
The animal has a +2 bonus to stability, and melee strikes against them take a bane.
Typically Used By: Beetles, crabs, turtles.
Whenever an adjacent enemy grabs the animal or uses a melee ability against them, that enemy takes 3 damage.
Typically Used By: Porcupines, urchins.
At the start of the animal’s turn, each enemy adjacent to the animal who has [M<1] must shift 1 square away from the animal.
Typically Used By: Oxen, skunks, wolverines.
The animal starts any combat encounter with 10 temporary Stamina. (This trait can be selected twice.)
Typically Used By: Bears, elephants, rhinoceroses.
Once per combat, when the animal is reduced to 0 Stamina, they can choose to either remain alive with 1 Stamina or immediately move up to their speed and make a free strike before dying.
Typically Used By: Bears, boars.
The animal ignores opportunity attacks and gains an edge on the Escape Grab maneuver.
Typically Used By: Eels, lizards, rats.
Whenever the animal takes damage, they can use a triggered action to halve that damage and all other damage they take until the start of their next turn.
Typically Used By: Armadillos, turtles.
When animals hunt or face off against threats, they bring a wide range of offensive traits to bear.
The animal’s signature ability has the Charge keyword, and they gain an edge on that ability if it is used as part of the Charge main action.
Typically Used By: Boars, rhinoceroses, swordfish.
The animal gains an edge on strikes against creatures who are bleeding or winded.
Typically Used By: Blood bats, piranhas, sharks.
If the target of the animal’s signature ability has [A<1], they are grabbed by the animal.
+1 Point: An enemy grabbed by the animal takes a bane on the Escape Grab maneuver.
Typically Used By: Apes, octopuses, snakes.
The animal ignores concealment.
Typically Used By: Eagles, rats, wolves.
The animal can target one additional creature or object whenever they make a free strike, use the Grab maneuver, or use the Knockback maneuver. (This trait can be selected twice.)
Typically Used By: Monkeys, octopuses, quadrakangas.
As a maneuver, the animal jumps up to 3 squares. If they land on an enemy their size or smaller, that enemy is knocked prone and the animal can make a free strike against them.
Typically Used By: Foxes, wild cats.
Whenever the animal force moves a target, they have a +2 bonus to the forced movement distance.
Typically Used By: Bears, bulls, lions.
The animal’s signature ability gains the Ranged keyword and adds Ranged 10 to its distance. Optional: The animal’s signature ability can deal acid or cold damage.
Typically Used By: Archer fish, snakes.
The animal’s signature ability gains a +2 bonus to distance. (This trait can be selected twice.)
Optional: The animal’s signature ability can deal fire or sonic damage.
Typically Used By: Frogs, giraffes, pistol shrimp.
The animal’s signature ability deals an extra 2 poison damage, and if the target has [M<1], they are weakened (save ends).
Typically Used By: Platypuses, snakes, wasps.
The animal gains the following ability.
Typically Used By: Pelagic snails, spiders.
Animals who channel magic or psionic power can show off a range of unusual supernatural traits.
Whenever the animal takes damage, each creature adjacent to the animal who has [M<1] takes damage equal to half the creature’s current Stamina.
Typically Used By: Death snails.

The animal has an affinity for one of the following damage types: acid, cold, corruption, fire, lightning, poison. The animal has damage immunity 3 to the chosen damage type, and their strikes deal the chosen damage type instead of their original damage type.
Typically Used By: Fire salamanders, ice bats.

The animal can move through spaces as if they were size 1T. Whenever the animal takes damage, they can use a triggered action to separate into two animals. Each new animal has the same statistics as the original but has half the original’s current Stamina.
Typically Used By: Earthworms, thunderjellies.
As a maneuver, the animal targets one enemy within 5 squares with their gaze, movements, or vocalizations. If the enemy has [R<1], they are dazed (save ends).
Typically Used By: Angler fish, snakes, tigers.
The animal’s size increases by 1 (to a minimum of size 2), and they gain a +2 bonus to stability. Additionally, the animal gains a +3 damage bonus to strikes.
Typically Used By: Dire animals, terror lizards.
The animal can move through solid matter, and strikes made against them take a bane. If the animal ends their turn inside solid matter, they are shunted out into the space from which they entered it.
Typically Used By: Barn owls, tiger wraiths.
The animal can teleport. +1 Point: The animal can also hover.
Typically Used By: Quantum spiders, thrazzes.

id-00010.traits_name1: While outdoors or in a natural environment, the animal can negate a bane on their abilities or turn a double bane into a bane.

id-00011.effect: If the target is pulled into the animal swarm, that forced movement deals damage only at the Director’s determination.
id-00011.effect_2: The area is difficult terrain for enemies until the start of the animal swarm’s next turn.
id-00011.name: Animal Swarm

id-00011.traits_name1: The animal swarm can move through spaces as if they were a size 1M creature, and can occupy other creatures’ spaces. At the start of each of the animal swarm’s turns, they can make a free strike against each creature whose space they share.
id-00011.traits_name2: While outdoors or in a natural environment, the animal swarm can negate a bane on their abilities or turn a double bane into a bane.

id-00012.effect_2: The target vertical slides up to 3 squares. If the target is an ally, they can make a free strike at the end of the forced movement, then fall without taking damage.
id-00012.effect_3: The animal shifts up to 2 squares before the ability resolves.
id-00012.name: Big Animal A

id-00012.special_2: The target must be the animal’s size or smaller.
id-00012.traits_name1: While outdoors or in a natural environment, the animal can negate a bane on their abilities or turn a double bane into a bane.
id-00012.trigger_3: The animal is targeted by an area ability.

id-00013.effect_2: The animal moves up to their speed. They can make a free strike against each creature who makes an opportunity attack against them during this movement.
id-00013.effect_3: The animal moves up to their speed. If they end their turn adjacent to the target, they can use the Stand Up maneuver to let the target stand, then get on to ride them.
id-00013.name: Big Animal B

On their turn, the animal can high jump or long jump up to half their speed. This jump can allow the animal to move more squares than their speed.
Typically Used By: Frogs, rabbits.
The animal can use a move action to shift up to 3 squares, even while prone.
Typically Used By: Snakes, vermin.
The animal has a +2 bonus to speed, and they ignore difficult terrain. (This trait can be selected twice.)
Typically Used By: Tigers, wolves.
The animal can automatically swim at full speed while moving.
Typically Used By: Fish, penguins.
Defensive traits help animals stay out of danger—or to set ambushes for unwary prey.
The animal can attempt to hide even while observed. While no enemy has line of effect to the animal, they can automatically hide at the end of their turn.
Typically Used By: Chameleons, foxes, tigers.
As a maneuver, the animal makes an imposing display. Each enemy within 2 squares of the animal who has [I<1] must shift 3 squares in a straight line away from the animal.
Typically Used By: Aardvarks, lions, peacocks.
While adjacent to an ally, the animal can’t be flanked or be made frightened.
Typically Used By: Hyenas, sheep, wolves.
The animal has a +2 bonus to stability, and melee strikes against them take a bane.
Typically Used By: Beetles, crabs, turtles.
Whenever an adjacent enemy grabs the animal or uses a melee ability against them, that enemy takes 3 damage.
Typically Used By: Porcupines, urchins.
At the start of the animal’s turn, each enemy adjacent to the animal who has [M<1] must shift 1 square away from the animal.
Typically Used By: Oxen, skunks, wolverines.
The animal starts any combat encounter with 10 temporary Stamina. (This trait can be selected twice.)
Typically Used By: Bears, elephants, rhinoceroses.
Once per combat, when the animal is reduced to 0 Stamina, they can choose to either remain alive with 1 Stamina or immediately move up to their speed and make a free strike before dying.
Typically Used By: Bears, boars.
The animal ignores opportunity attacks and gains an edge on the Escape Grab maneuver.
Typically Used By: Eels, lizards, rats.
Whenever the animal takes damage, they can use a triggered action to halve that damage and all other damage they take until the start of their next turn.
Typically Used By: Armadillos, turtles.
When animals hunt or face off against threats, they bring a wide range of offensive traits to bear.
The animal’s signature ability has the Charge keyword, and they gain an edge on that ability if it is used as part of the Charge main action.
Typically Used By: Boars, rhinoceroses, swordfish.
The animal gains an edge on strikes against creatures who are bleeding or winded.
Typically Used By: Blood bats, piranhas, sharks.
If the target of the animal’s signature ability has [A<1], they are grabbed by the animal.
+1 Point: An enemy grabbed by the animal takes a bane on the Escape Grab maneuver.
Typically Used By: Apes, octopuses, snakes.
The animal ignores concealment.
Typically Used By: Eagles, rats, wolves.
The animal can target one additional creature or object whenever they make a free strike, use the Grab maneuver, or use the Knockback maneuver. (This trait can be selected twice.)
Typically Used By: Monkeys, octopuses, quadrakangas.
As a maneuver, the animal jumps up to 3 squares. If they land on an enemy their size or smaller, that enemy is knocked prone and the animal can make a free strike against them.
Typically Used By: Foxes, wild cats.
Whenever the animal force moves a target, they have a +2 bonus to the forced movement distance.
Typically Used By: Bears, bulls, lions.
The animal’s signature ability gains the Ranged keyword and adds Ranged 10 to its distance. Optional: The animal’s signature ability can deal acid or cold damage.
Typically Used By: Archer fish, snakes.
The animal’s signature ability gains a +2 bonus to distance. (This trait can be selected twice.)
Optional: The animal’s signature ability can deal fire or sonic damage.
Typically Used By: Frogs, giraffes, pistol shrimp.
The animal’s signature ability deals an extra 2 poison damage, and if the target has [M<1], they are weakened (save ends).
Typically Used By: Platypuses, snakes, wasps.
The animal gains the following ability.
Typically Used By: Pelagic snails, spiders.
Animals who channel magic or psionic power can show off a range of unusual supernatural traits.
Whenever the animal takes damage, each creature adjacent to the animal who has [M<1] takes damage equal to half the creature’s current Stamina.
Typically Used By: Death snails.

The animal has an affinity for one of the following damage types: acid, cold, corruption, fire, lightning, poison. The animal has damage immunity 3 to the chosen damage type, and their strikes deal the chosen damage type instead of their original damage type.
Typically Used By: Fire salamanders, ice bats.

The animal can move through spaces as if they were size 1T. Whenever the animal takes damage, they can use a triggered action to separate into two animals. Each new animal has the same statistics as the original but has half the original’s current Stamina.
Typically Used By: Earthworms, thunderjellies.
As a maneuver, the animal targets one enemy within 5 squares with their gaze, movements, or vocalizations. If the enemy has [R<1], they are dazed (save ends).
Typically Used By: Angler fish, snakes, tigers.
The animal’s size increases by 1 (to a minimum of size 2), and they gain a +2 bonus to stability. Additionally, the animal gains a +3 damage bonus to strikes.
Typically Used By: Dire animals, terror lizards.
The animal can move through solid matter, and strikes made against them take a bane. If the animal ends their turn inside solid matter, they are shunted out into the space from which they entered it.
Typically Used By: Barn owls, tiger wraiths.
The animal can teleport. +1 Point: The animal can also hover.
Typically Used By: Quantum spiders, thrazzes.

id-00013.traits_name1: While riding the animal, two size 1 allies can occupy the same space.
id-00013.traits_name2: While outdoors or in a natural environment, the animal can negate a bane on their abilities or turn a double bane into a bane.

id-00014.effect_2: The predator assesses their environment or lets loose a threatening roar and gains an edge on their next strike.
id-00014.effect_3: The predator makes a free strike against the target. If the predator was hidden from the target, the strike deals an extra 3 damage.
id-00014.name: Predator A

notes.p: The natural denizens of every world, animals ferocious, atrocious, and precocious roam the lands between and among settlements of humanoids and other folk. Whether they graze or hunt, stay solitary or move in packs, fight danger or fly from it, all animals share a singular goal—to live. Most animals are not monsters, but some are twisted by magic and malice to become monsters. A hero wouldn’t mercilessly kill a pack of hungry wolves—but they’ll slay rot-magic dire wolves created by vampires. In many cases, animals are more likely to be bystanders than threats in an encounter.

This section presents a number of default animal stat blocks with basic features. You can customize those stat blocks by adding traits from the following categories to more closely model the animal’s most identifiable features. You can spend up to 4 points on traits to add to a stat block without increasing the encounter value. Each point you spend after 4 increases the stat block’s EV by 2. Unless otherwise specified, you can select a trait only once.
Mobility traits cover a wide range of the options that keep animals moving.
The animal can burrow.
+1 Point: The animal can burrow through stone, creating a tunnel of their size in each square of stone they move through.

id-00014.trigger_3: A creature or object comes within distance.

id-00015.effect: End Effect: At the end of each of their turns, the arixx can take 5 damage to end one effect on them that can be ended by a saving throw. This damage can’t be reduced in any way. \nSolo Turns: The arixx can take two turns each round. They can’t take turns consecutively.
id-00015.effect_2: A size 1 target grabbed this way takes 3 acid damage at the start of each of their turns.
id-00015.effect_3: The arixx can vertically slide each grabbed target up to 3 squares.
id-00015.effect_4: The ground beneath each target is covered in burning acid until the end of the encounter. Any enemy who enters an affected space for the first time in a round or starts their turn there takes 2 acid damage.
id-00015.effect_5: The arixx flings rocks and debris to fill the area, and has a double edge on the power roll if they started their turn underground. The area is difficult terrain.
id-00015.effect_6: The arixx kicks up dust to fill the area until the start of their next turn, then moves up to their speed. Any enemy in the area or who targets a creature in the area takes a bane on power rolls.
id-00015.effect_7: The arixx halves the damage and shifts up to 3 squares after the triggering effect resolves.
id-00015.effect_8: The ground in the area is covered in a puddle of acid until the end of the encounter. Any enemy who enters the area for the first time in a round or starts their turn there takes 2 acid damage.
id-00015.effect_9: The arixx shifts up to their speed. If they end this shift above ground and within 2 squares of a creature, they use Bite against the creature and can then use the Dig maneuver.
id-00015.name: Arixx

notes.p: Pebbles dance as the ground quivers. A spray of rock and earth shatters the afternoon’s peace, and an arixx blooms from the earth. Their mandibles drip sizzling acid as a talon impales their next meal— sometimes a fat sheep, other times a shepherd.

An arixx is a chitinous burrowing insectoid beast who stands taller than a horse. Their hooked claws and serrated mandibles are fearsome weapons, but even more dangerous is the stream of caustic spittle they use to dissolve their prey.

Although arixxi can be found anywhere, they are a particular plague in settled lands. An arixx hunts alone, lurking a few feet below roadways and pastures. When their sensitive antennae detect movement above, they burst from the earth, dragging living prey into their tunnels to be devoured. These hit-and-run tactics make the arixx virtually impossible to eradicate—unless they have the bad luck to ambush a party of well-armed adventurers. Many communities pay a handsome bounty for a slain arixx.

Arixxi are a year-round menace in the warmest lands. In temperate places, arixxi hibernate during the winter, granting farmers a season of peace. But this respite is paid for on the first thaw of spring, when every arixx awakens ravenous on the same day and bursts from the ground to feed.
At the start of an arixx’s turn, you can spend Malice to activate one of the following features.

id-00015.target_8: Each creature and object in the area
id-00015.traits_name1: Difficult terrain composed of earth or loose rock doesn’t cost the arixx extra movement.
id-00015.traits_name2: A prone creature making a melee strike against the arixx has a double edge on the strike instead of taking a bane.

id-00016.effect_3: The target is pushed up to 5 squares.
id-00016.name: Predator B

id-00016.target_2: Each enemy or object in the area
id-00016.traits_name1: The predator can move through enemies’ and objects’ spaces at their usual speed. Any mundane size 2 or smaller object whose space they move through is destroyed. When the predator enters a creature’s space for the first time on a turn, that creature takes 3 damage.
id-00016.traits_name2: While outdoors or in a natural environment, the predator can negate a bane on their abilities or turn a double bane into a bane.
